channel.title: Math help - im dumb
channel.description:
[img]http://img357.imageshack.us/img357/1473/untitledzm2.jpg[/img]
Can someone explain how the hell this is done im about to stab my teacher she don't explain!

item.title: Math help - im dumb
item.dc:creator: @kajmon kajmon
item.description:
@kajmon wrote:

You find the area of a triangle by multiplying 1/2bh, or half times base times height. To find the area of a pyramid you multiply however many triangles there are on the pyramid and then you have to find the area of the square, area of the square is length times with or l times w

Read full topic

item.title: Math help - im dumb
item.dc:creator: @CRIPZ_Chick CRIPZ Chick
item.description:
@CRIPZ_Chick wrote:

[quote=“The Producer, post:2, topic:57819”]All you have to do is follow the formulas. Notice the formulas have A and that means area. For a.), the cylinder has circles on the sides and a large rectangle wrapping around them. 2 areas are said here: circle and rectangle.

First, find the area of the circle: A = pi*r^2, r = 5
(A = pi (5)^2)

Then, find the area of the rectangle: A = l * w, l = 12, w = 5
(A = 12*5)

From the formula A[size=9pt]1[/size] = A[size=9pt]1[/size] + 2A[size=9pt]b[/size], replace A[size=9pt]1[/size] with area of the rectangle and replace 2A[size=9pt]b[/size] with the area of the circle. The reason why replace 2A[size=9pt]b[/size] with the area of the circle is because there are 2 circles. Now add them up and there is your first answer.[/quote]

exactly right!

Read full topic

item.title: Math help - im dumb
item.dc:creator: @The_Producer The Producer
item.description:
@The_Producer wrote:

All you have to do is follow the formulas. Notice the formulas have A and that means area. For a.), the cylinder has circles on the sides and a large rectangle wrapping around them. 2 areas are said here: circle and rectangle.

First, find the area of the circle: A = pi*r^2, r = 5
(A = pi (5)^2)

Then, find the area of the rectangle: A = l * w, l = 12, w = 5
(A = 12*5)

From the formula A[size=9pt]1[/size] = A[size=9pt]1[/size] + 2A[size=9pt]b[/size], replace A[size=9pt]1[/size] with area of the rectangle and replace 2A[size=9pt]b[/size] with the area of the circle. The reason why replace 2A[size=9pt]b[/size] with the area of the circle is because there are 2 circles. Now add them up and there is your first answer.

Read full topic
